alert.note: Alert for North Snowy Range Foothills; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 4:10PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Carbon and west central Albany Counties through 500 PM MDT... At 410 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sugar Loaf Campground, or 38 miles west of Laramie, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Nash Fork Campground, Brooklyn Lake, Brooklyn Lake Campground, Sugar Loaf Campground, Bow River Campground, Deep Creek Campground and Arlington. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 260 and 281. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: North Snowy Range Foothills; Snowy Range
